title: Caching with plain text
content:
I added a tiny text cache for expensive reads. Responses get written to a `.cache` folder with short TTLs, and invalidation is a file delete.

It is crude but effective: no daemons, no external services. Just fast file reads and predictable fallbacks when the cache expires.

The simplicity keeps the system observable. If a cache misbehaves, I can read it with `cat` and fix it with `rm`.
